page.title: 01THE NORTHERN PART OF GOSPORT
page.content: THE AREA COVERED IN THESE SQUARES COMPRISES THE NORTHERN PART OF THE BOROUGH OF GOSPORT AND THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE BOROUGH OF FAREHAM. THE NAVAL INFLUENCE IN THE AREA IS CONSIDERABLE. H.M.S. COLLINGWOOD AND H.M.S. DAEDALUS AS WELL AS THE R.N.A.Y FLEETLANDS ARE SITUATED HERE. AS THE SIZE OF THE NAVY HAS DECLINED, ALTERNATIVE EMPLOYMENT HAS GROWN UP IN A NUMBER OF INDUSTRIAL ESTATES SUCH AS THOSE AT FORT FAREHAM AND NEWGATE LANE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NEWLANDS FARM, MOST OF THE OPEN SPACES IN THE AREA ARE M.O.D. PROPERTY. THE MAIN RESIDENTIAL AREA IS BRIDGEMARY - ORIGINALLY BEGUN AS HOUSING FOR THOSE WHO LOST THEIR HOMES IN GOSPORT DURING WORLD WAR 2 BOMBING RAIDS. THE HISTORIC STRATEGIC IMPORTANCE OF GOSPORT IS EXEMPLIFIED BY FORT BROCKHURST - NOW OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.
